title-group.article-title: Status Report on Aircraft and Airports as Sources of Pollution

permissions.copyright-statement: Â© Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc., 1972

abstract.p: The sources of pollution from aircraft and airports are reviewed, with emphasis placed on the industry's current understanding of the magnitude and control technology applicable to such sources. The progress of industry activity in reducing pollution from aircraft is presented, including on-going research directed at defining the impact, source strength, and applicable control technology. The unknowns and the areas in which research is needed and not currently under way also are identified.

ref.mixed-citation: R. E. George and R. M. Burlin, 'Air Pollution from Com- mercial Jet Aircraft in Los Angeles County." Los Angeles Air Pollution Control District Report, April 1960.
M. Nolan, "A Survey of Air Pollution in Communities Around John F. Kennedy Airport." Public Health Service, U.S. Department of Health, Education and Welfare, June 1966.
E. E. Lemke, N. R. Shaffer, and J. A. Verssen, "Air Pollu- tion from Jet Aircraft in Los Angeles County." Los Angeles Air Pollution Control District, December 1965.
"Nature and Control of Aircraft Engine Exhaust Emis- sions." Report of the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare to the U.S. Congress, December 1968.

"Nature and Control of Aircraft Engine Exhaust Emis- sions." Report to the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare to the U.S. Congress; Northern Research and Engi- neering Corp. Report 1134, November 1968.
